textos_fuente.text: FAQs – tampablackheritage.org Skip to content Menu About TBBHF Organization Info About Mission Statement Board of Directors Applications and Registration Support Support the Festival Sponsorship Volunteer Vendor Opportunities Media TBBHF Over the Years Media Gallery Press Events Join the fun Events Music Fest 2025 Run For Us Festival Events Partner Events Seminars Business Seminars College & Career Conversations Maps & Parking Music Fest Map Downtown Parking Seminars Learn More Business Seminars College & Career Conversations Volunteer Get Involved Contact Us Today or send a Suggestion Quick Links About Us Sponsorship Music Fest 2025 Run For Us 5K FAQs Facebook Twitter Instagram YouTube Open Search Window Home FAQs FAQs See below for answers to frequent questions about the festival and it’s events. What is the Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival? The Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival (TBBHF) is Southwest Florida’s premier cultural event and destination location. This an annual, family friendly, cultural experience focuses on health, education, economic, social empowerment and the arts. The signature 2-Day Music Fest, which takes place the weekend before the weekend of the MLK Holiday and extends through the month April; and features local and nationally recognized musicians, artists, speakers, and craftspeople. TBBHF is organized by the Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival, a 501 c3, Florida non-profit corporation.  The event for the entire community and visiting tourist to our area. When does the Festival Take Place? Annually in January the weekend before of the Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. Holiday with signature events taking place through the month of April. When’s the best time to travel? If you’re traveling into Tampa, Florida, we recommend you come into the city a day prior to the event(s) you wish to attend.  Please click on Travel, Transit & Parking on the main page or on Accommodations on the Music Fest page for all travel needs.  AAA members may receive a discount. Where will the Music Fest be located? The Music Fest is located in Tampa, Florida, at the Curtis Hixon Waterfront Park, Downtown Tampa, 600 N Ashley Drive, Tampa, Florida 33602. Where downtown can I park for the 2-Day Music Fest? Parking is available in the Poe Garage, closet to park and in other Garages located downtown, as well as hourly street parking throughout the downtown area.  Uber and Lyft ride drop offs is in a designated area near the park. Where do I enter Curtis Hixon Waterfront Park for the Festival? Gate Entry to the Music Fest is located on Ashley Street. Are there restrictions to what I can bring into Curtis Hixon Waterfront Park? April is a HOT month, please hydrate at least 24 hours in advance.  Water Stations will be available in the park. What items are permitted: Small bags and backpacks (All bags will be searched prior to entry) Wheelchairs and medical scooters Strollers for children Cell phones Lawn chairs with low backs (general area) Lawn chairs with connected sun covers (assigned to a designated area with like chairs) Empty Water bottles only ( will be checked at entry gate) What items are NOT permitted: Alcohol (All spirits are for sale on-site) Illegal drugs Glass containers or outside Steins Coolers and thermoses Umbrellas and tents (that obstruct the view of others) Video and audio recording equipment Wagons, Skateboards and Segways Weapons(including with permits to carry), illicit drugs and other contraband. Outside food and beverages are not permitted.  We are a non-profit charity and solicit your support.  There are plenty of vendors within the park that offer a wide variety of food options at reasonable prices. Soda, juice, water, beer, wine and alcohol are available for purchase. Where are the other Festival events located? Additional Festival events take place throughout the Tampa Bay area. For a complete list of dates, times, locations, and events, visit the Events section of our website. How much is it to attend the Festival? Tickets prices varies based the selected signature event.  Fees for the 2-Day Music vary based on seat selection. Children 12 and under are free.  Music Fest seating consist of General Admission, Preferred Seating and VIP Tented area.  Advance ticket purchases are highly recommended.  Some events may not allow for onsite sales.  Visit Events page for ticket prices. When will you be posting the schedule? Sign up for our e-newsletter, like us on Facebook, follow us on Twitter and Instagram to get the latest on our lineup.  Music Fest schedule will be posted as soon as available or after the Christmas Holidays. How do I get press credentials? For general press inquiries or to request media credentials please email info@TampaBlackHeritage.org.  For tickets and more information about the Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival, please visit www.TampaBlackHeritage.org. How can I participate in the Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival? Interested in Volunteering, please visit our website www.TampaBlackHeritage.org, and register.  To inquire about entertainment/speaker, please complete the “Contact Us” form on our website and someone will contact you. How can I become a vendor? Go to the “Vendor” section of our website, complete and submit a vendor’s application online or print the application and mail with fees to:  TBBHF, PO Box 16622, Tampa, FL 33687. How do I sign up for Festival e-mail newsletters? Our FREE Festival e-mail newsletters include the latest line-up updates, weekend schedules, official events and special offers from the Festival and our partners.   Sign-up on the website main page. What are the hotel options? Go to our website Home page and click on Travel, Transit & Parking or Events via the menu tab and click on Accommodations for travel packages. Are there airline packages? AAA Travel Packages can be purchased via the website; or reach out to a travel agent of choice to make your flight reservations.  We recommend that you purpose airfare, at least, 30 days in advance for the best possible rates. Can I drive to Tampa for the Festival? Yes, and free parking may be available at most of the Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival signature events (based on availability). You will incur a fee for parking downtown and in available Garages, for the Music Fest.  Parking is first come, first serve basis. What kind of access do I get with my preferred seating Music Fest pass? Preferred seating at Music Fest comes with seating in a gated area, near the front of the stage, just behind the VIP seating.  First come, First serve.  Everyone entering the Park will receive a wristband. Can I sign up to receive Festival-related text alerts? TBD Is photographic or recording equipment permitted at the festival? Cell phone camera are permitted. NO Drones are permitted.  If caught will be confiscated.  Audio and video recording devices are NOT permitted. Is this a dog-friendly event? Yes, dogs are welcome at the Music Fest.  It’s an outdoor family event. Is this a kid-friendly event? The Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival is a family-friendly event and offers FREE admission for kid 12 and under.  We have a Children’s Village area with kid-friendly activities until 6pm Saturday and Sunday at the Music Fest.   One of our signature events is designated for the Youth, were young people take over the stage, express what cultural heritage means to them and learn about important matters that will educate them on being the best person they can be. What kind of music will there be? Old School, Jazz, Neo-Soul, R&B, Gospel, Reggae, and more. Where should I direct general inquiries? For information about sponsorship, performance/appearance requests or any general Festival questions, please e-mail Info@TampaBlackHeritage.org. Are there any additional policies? No unauthorized vending. TBBHF reserves the right to deny entry or remove from the festival anyone in violation of these policies.   The Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival reserves the right to sell all Beverages.  Vendors in violation of this will be removed and no refund will be issued.  Only good, positive, family fun is allowed during the Festival events. Is the Music Festival accessible for those with disabilities? Yes. The park is ADA (Americans with Disabilities Act) compliant. How can I submit my artist or band to play at the Music Fest? TBBHF is always excepting submissions. Email press kit, website, and links to performances to info@tampablackheritage.org How can I become a sponsor? TBBHF is a not for profit company and is sponsored by individuals and corporate sponsors. Your support is greatly appreciated and there are several levels of opportunities designed to fit your company’s needs and budget. Please visit the sponsorship page on the website or for details or email us at sponsorship@TampaBlackHeritage.org to learn how you can become a sponsor. If you would like more information about any up-and-coming event, how to become a vendor, and more, get in touch with us! Contact Us Today Comments are closed. Home About TBBHF Announcements DONATE The Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival is the largest African-American event in the bay area and has been selected as one of the Top 20 Events by the Southeast Tourism Society six times, during it’s tenure. Please click the “ Donate Now ” and help us continue our cause. Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival, Inc. Get Tickets Now Relive the Moments Business Seminars TBBHF Business Seminars Empowering Black Entrepreneurs Registration is now open for our Summer Business Seminar of 2025 featuring experts in business and finance. We encourage everyone to register today! Learn More and Register Tampa Black Heritage Festival Returns in 2026! Signature Events from January through April 2026 Annual 2-Day Music Fest on April 25-26, 2026 Relive Moments from 2025 Vendor Opportunities Be a vendor with us! As a vendor at our 2-Day Music Festival, vendors are able to display their array of diverse goods, cuisine and desserts at largest African-American event in the bay area that has been selected as one of the Top 20 Events by the Southeast Tourism Society six times, during it’s tenure. Vendor Info Be a volunteer. We want your help. Volunteers are the heart of a committees. Our volunteers are a valuable resource for our festival year after year. Our festival relies on our volunteers for everything from staffing special events, sponsorships, to assisting committees with daily activities, marketing, logistics, and program events. If interested in being apart of the TBBHF family, join one of our committees. How To Apply Business Seminars Business Empowerment The Tampa Black Heritage Festival hosts business seminars as part of its annual celebration, focusing on empowering the Black community through networking, professional development, and entrepreneurship. These seminars feature industry leaders, local business owners, and financial experts who share valuable insights on topics like small business growth, financial literacy, and innovative marketing strategies. Seminars Upcoming Event Line Up See what's happening and join the festivities! No Upcoming Festival Events View Festival Events Stay up-to-date with the latest TBBHF news! Board of Directors – tampablackheritage.org Skip to content Menu About TBBHF Organization Info About Mission Statement Board of Directors Applications and Registration Support Support the Festival Sponsorship Volunteer Vendor Opportunities Media TBBHF Over the Years Media Gallery Press Events Join the fun Events Music Fest 2025 Run For Us Festival Events Partner Events Seminars Business Seminars College & Career Conversations Maps & Parking Music Fest Map Downtown Parking Seminars Learn More Business Seminars College & Career Conversations Volunteer Get Involved Contact Us Today or send a Suggestion Quick Links About Us Sponsorship Music Fest 2025 Run For Us 5K FAQs Facebook Twitter Instagram YouTube Open Search Window Home Board of Directors Board of Directors Dr. Samuel Wright, Sr Founder The Festival’s founder, Dr. Samuel Lamar Wright, Sr. and the Tampa Bay Convention and Visitors Bureau, a major contributor, had a vision to raise awareness of the African and African-American heritage within the Tampa Bay Area and surrounding community. The result of their combined efforts was increased exposure to African and African-American culture through positive images and achievements. Ruby Jackson Chairperson & Events Coordinator Ruby Jackson is a recent retired senior human resource business partner at the University of South Florida, where she worked for more than three decades in the College of Education. She is looking forward to celebrating the next phase of her life. A native of Tampa and a mother of two sons, a daugther-in-law and four grandchildren.  Ruby has dedicated years of engagement in the community where she was born and raised. Williams Sanders Chairperson & Entertainment Coordinator William is the Founder of Unlimited Gospel Expressions and a Gospel Music Historian. He has been involved with the Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival since the beginning and he has been instrumental in incorporating the Gospel components while actively helping to coordinate other Festival events. He is active in his church, the Tampa Bay religious community and has been a Festival Chairperson since 2010. Ivy Box Marketing Coordinator Ivy is a Florida native of Haitian descent, who was actively involved with the Festival for a decade before joining the Board.  She brings her experiences in the corporate, entertainment, and philanthropic industries where she has cultivated a niche of bridging the intergenerational gap through marketing. Ivy is a marketing professional, author, community leader, and philanthropist who believes that the sky is not the limit; it is only the beginning. Connie Hicks Sponsorship Coordinator Connie is a native of Kingsport, TN but has called Florida her home for the past 34 years. She has always been an advocate for community service and encourages her children to be advocates as well. Connie joined the board in 2012 to bring her expertise and enthusiasm to the sponsorship and gala committees. Connie is currently employed by Florida Blue which supports and also encourages her volunteer efforts. David Hall Logistics Coordinator David Hall, a native of Munich, Germany, by way of Pemberton, New Jersey, is a General Manager and Senior Estimator for a large construction company.  While in school, he studied Architectural Design and won several awards from the State of New Jersey for his drawings. David Hall is a proud father, former engineer, and former restaurateur of several successful restaurants and lounges. Robert West Director Robert R. West, Jr. is the Community Development Manager of Central & North Florida for TD Bank and an adjunct business professor. Mr. West specializes in consulting diverse communities on the lending opportunities for home ownership and small business & commercial banking solutions.  Mr. West’s Veteran status includes 5 years in the U.S. Marine Corps Reserve as a combat engineer and 3 years active duty as a recruiter.  Mr. West separated from the Marine Corps with the rank of Staff Sergeant (E-6). Michael Spears Director Michael is a native on New Jersey and has been located in Tampa for the last 10 years. Michael is passionate about bringing awareness to the Black and African American community. Casting a wide net teaching and bringing awareness to Black History and customs through ongoing contact with all local communities. Jarvis Meeks Director Jarvis Meeks, a Florida native, is an experienced educator in middle school mathematics. He began his career in architecture after graduating from Tuskegee University. After several years of practicing architecture. He later received his Master’s in Business Administration from the University of Phoenix. Meeks has served as a member on several boards such as the SAC Committee, The Lake Wales Arts Council along with various other civic and religious organizations. Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival, Inc. In the meantime, check out some highlights from our 2025 Business Seminar below. TBBHF Business Seminar Series is a series of professional business seminars hosted by the Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival and the Entrepreneur Collaborative Center . The series takes place throughout the summer and fall months with the larger seminar taking place during the annual Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival in January. The Tampa Bay Black Heritage Entrepreneur Advisory Board, are comprised of local professional business owners who encompass a vast amount of knowledge and skills to help you better your business. TBBHF BUSINESS SEMINAR Empowering Black Entrepreneurs Series Entrepreneur Collaborative Center
2101 E Palm Ave, Tampa, FL  33605 9:00 AM - 11:00 AM Register Today - Free Event Moderated by Leighton Kyler, The InsideOutPreneur, Coach, and Speaker Friday, April 18, 2025 - Leveraging AI for New Revenue Generation Seminar covering economic tips and advise for minority business owners. Register Here April 18, 2025 – Panel Speakers Shaunette Stokes Speaker/Panelist Rolanda  McDuffie CPA, Accounting Leighton Kyler Moderator - Speaker/Panelist Courtney Cress Vice President, Operations - Acuity Technologies Yasmine Gardiner Founder of ClearSet.AI Shaunette Stokes Speaker/Panelist Shaunette BIO Shaunette Stokes, the founder and Managing Partner of Stokes Law Group, is a successful entrepreneur and attorney with a passion for empowering business owners and helping them achieve their goals. With years of experience in both the legal and business realms, Shaunette possesses a unique perspective and skill set that enables her to provide invaluable guidance to her clients. Shaunette’s educational journey began at Florida A&M University, where she earned a bachelor’s degree in Political Science. She continued her education at the same institution, graduating Magna Cum Laude with a master’s degree in Public Administration. Shaunette then pursued her Juris Doctorate from North Carolina Central University School of Law in Durham, North Carolina. Her legal expertise encompasses a broad range of areas, including Intellectual Property, Estate Planning, Probate, and Personal Injury. Shaunette is a practicing attorney licensed in the state of Florida and is dedicated to staying at the forefront of legal knowledge. Her commitment to lifelong learning extends beyond her own education; she currently serves as an adjunct professor in the Paralegal Studies program at Hillsborough Community College, teaching courses in Copyright and Music Law, as well as Contract Law. In addition to her legal accomplishments, Shaunette is an experienced entrepreneur who understands the challenges and opportunities that business owners face. This background enables her to provide insightful advice on how to grow businesses or protect them from litigation. She works with a diverse group of clients, assisting entrepreneurs and individuals alike as they navigate the legal landscape and focus on their core competencies. Shaunette’s dedication to helping others extends beyond the courtroom and the classroom. She regularly speaks to various groups about the complexities of the law in their communities, further establishing herself as an expert in her field. Her goal in life is not just to excel in her own career, but to make a positive impact on the lives of others through her knowledge, experience, and passion for the law. When you choose to work with Shaunette Stokes, you’re not just gaining a skilled attorney – you’re partnering with a dedicated advocate who is committed to your success. Let Shaunette’s expertise and dedication to client satisfaction guide you and your business toward a brighter future. Rolanda  McDuffie CPA, Accounting Rolanda 's BIO I’m a Certified Public Accountant (CPA) specializing in business owners but with a heart for the nonprofit sector. My passion lies in empowering nonprofit organizations to achieve financial fitness and long-term sustainability. With a focus on accounting, taxes, advisory services, and board training, my goal is to help these organizations flourish, serving their communities to the fullest. My specialty doesn’t stop at traditional accounting. I offer CFO services, fiscal sponsorship, fiduciary agency services, and crucial pre-audit assistance, ensuring nonprofits are grant-ready, compliant with government regulations, and well-equipped for sustainable growth. From creating strategic budgets and cash flow management to understanding intricate financial statements and preparing the pivotal Form 990, I guide nonprofits to unlock more funding opportunities. I am committed to helping these organizations understand and navigate the intricate world of finance so they can focus on their true mission: making a positive impact. A free spirit with a great sense of humor, I take pride in my down-to-earth approach and genuine desire to help. I believe that with the right financial foundation, every nonprofit can soar to new heights. Join me in my mission to uplift and support the unsung heroes of our communities – our nonprofits. Leighton Kyler Moderator - Speaker/Panelist Leighton's BIO Leighton Kyler is people focused and principle driven. Leighton possesses over 30 years of Entrepreneurial and Corporate leadership experience. Leighton is divinely gifted and masterfully talented as a soul coach, global speaker and consultant. He specializes in InsideOut Leadership, Mental – Emotional – Relationship Wellness, Revenue Generation, and Sales Mastery. Leighton is an Enterprise Architect, a Master of Business Administration (MBA) with a concentration in Finance & Operations and a thesis on Business Intelligence. He is a Project Management Professional (PMP), and an Accountant. He gives God all the glory as a husband, father, and a family man.  Leighton is a Servant Leader with enthusiasm that is highly contagious. Courtney Cress Vice President, Operations - Acuity Technologies Courtney's BIO Vice President, Operations at Acuity Technologies Yasmine Gardiner Founder of ClearSet.AI Yasmine 's BIO Yasmine Gardiner is a passionate and results-driven expert with 6 years of diverse skillsets in Data Science, Machine Learning, Data Quality, Customer Service, and Market Research. With a keen eye for patterns & trends, and a heart for customer satisfaction, Ms. Gardiner thrives on transforming raw data into valuable insights and actionable solutions.  If you are looking to leverage artificial intelligence to enhance your business, drive innovation, or improve customer experiences, Ms. Gardiner would love to connect with you!  Let’s explore how we can collaborate and achieve remarkable outcomes together. In honor of Bill Trotman Bill Trotman, a native of Tampa, Florida, was born to entrepreneurial-minded parents where he developed a love for his community and a love for being a business owner. In 2007, he was introduced to board members of the Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival, cultivated a partnership, and introduced a financial workshop for the attendees of the festival. Bill eventually joined the Festival’s Board of Directors where he grew the Business and Financial Seminar from a one-man show to a seminar series and Signature Festival event that continues on today. Privately, in March of 2020, Bill Trotman succumbed to his battle with cancer. The Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival and his TD Bank Family will forever be grateful for his contributions and will continue to honor his legacy. Rest in Peace Bill Trotman! Comments are closed. Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival, Inc. Music Fest 2025 – tampablackheritage.org Skip to content Menu About TBBHF Organization Info About Mission Statement Board of Directors Applications and Registration Support Support the Festival Sponsorship Volunteer Vendor Opportunities Media TBBHF Over the Years Media Gallery Press Events Join the fun Events Music Fest 2025 Run For Us Festival Events Partner Events Seminars Business Seminars College & Career Conversations Maps & Parking Music Fest Map Downtown Parking Seminars Learn More Business Seminars College & Career Conversations Volunteer Get Involved Contact Us Today or send a Suggestion Quick Links About Us Sponsorship Music Fest 2025 Run For Us 5K FAQs Facebook Twitter Instagram YouTube Open Search Window Main MF Slide 2-Day Music Fest - April 25-26, 2026 Experience one of the most exciting times of the year celebrating black art, food, music and culture as we celebrate the Tampa Black Heritage Festival! Get Tickets Now Main MF Slide 2-Day Music Fest - April 25-26, 2026 Experience one of the most exciting times of the year celebrating black art, food, music and culture as we celebrate the Tampa Black Heritage Festival! Get Tickets Now Experience one of the most exciting times of the year celebrating black art, food, music and culture at the 2026 TBBHF Music Fest ! Coming this April 25-26, 2026! 2026 Music Fest Details QUICK FACTS ABOUT THE FESTIVAL Need to Know Location Curtis Hixon Waterfront Park 600 N Ashley Drive, Tampa, FL33602 Time April 25 and 26, 2026.  Gates open at 12pm. Tickets General Admission,  Preferred Seating, and VIP Tickets coming soon. 2025 Music Fest Highlights Jeff Bradshaw TBBHF Music Fest Performer Sunday, April 27, 2025 Jeff Bradshaw A North Philadelphia-born soul-jazz and hip-hop/funk innovator and trombone virtuoso, Jeff Bradshaw spent his formative years honing his chops alongside some of the biggest names both in and out of the Philly soul movement. By the time he got around to releasing his solo debut, 2004's critically acclaimed Bone Deep, he had shared the stage with such industry luminaries as Michael Jackson, Earth, Wind & Fire, Patti Labelle, Erykah Badu, and countless others. Bone Deep made him a festival circuit mainstay, and he spent the next eight years refining his signature smooth and immediate sound in both a solo setting and in support of artists like Mary J. Blige, Jay-Z, the Roots, and Jill Scott. In 2012 he released his sophomore long-player, Bone Appetit, which featured a host of guest artists, including Kindred the Family Soul, Raheem DeVaughn, Floacist, and Marsha Ambrosius. Jeff Bradshaw Website Raheem DeVaughn TBBHF Music Fest Performer Sunday, April 27, 2025 Raheem DeVaughn The son of an accomplished avant-garde jazz cellist, Raheem DeVaughn is an urban R&B singer and songwriter who gets inspiration from the great crooners of the past such as Marvin Gaye, to more contemporary singers like D'Angelo. With two albums and a Grammy nomination, DeVaughn's musical style leans as much as it does towards neo-soul and R&B as it does towards a timeless soul sound he hopes to create through his musical legacy. Rather than having critics or record labels define his sound, DeVaughn came up with his own genre which he describes as, "R&B/hippie/neo-soul/rockstar in a hip-hop world," he affirmed to Vibe writer Shayla Byrd. A DeVaughn fan and fellow musician, Alicia Keys, told journalist Clarence Waldron of Jet, "Raheem is a gem …. He embodies the soul and raw honesty of the legendary artists we long for." Raheem DeVaughn Website Eric Roberson TBBHF Music Fest Performer Sunday, April 27, 2025 Eric Roberson An American singer, songwriter, former rapper and music producer. He is sometimes referred to simply as Erro, the name which he later used as part of his label Blue Erro Soul.  Roberson was nominated for two Grammys in the Best Urban/Alternative Performance category.  He was nominated for two songs from his 2009 album Music Fan First- "A Tale of Two" in 2010 and "Still" in the same category a year later. In 2013, he was a member of the band, United Tenors together with Dave Hollister, Fred Hammond and Brian Courtney Wilson. Roberson's 2014 album, The Box, peaked at #8 on the Billboard Top R&B Albums. "I Have A Song" was chosen to be the fundraising single, produced by Jak Beula and released in February 2016,  In 2024, Roberson signed with the Universal Music Group distributed label SoNo Recording Group. His first release for the label is the Jeff Lorber featured "Every Kinda People", a cover of the 1978 Robert Palmer single. Eric Roberson Website Morris Day Experience one of the most exciting times of the year celebrating black art, food, music and culture as we celebrate 25 years of the Tampa Black Heritage Festival! TBBHF Music Fest Performer Sunday, April 27, 2025 Morris Day and the Time Morris Day and the Time, is an American funk rock band founded in Minneapolis in 1981. They contributed to the development of the Minneapolis sound, an eclectic fusion of funk, R&B, new wave, synth-pop and dance. Led by singer-songwriter Morris Day the band members are known for having been close associates of musician Prince, and are arguably the most successful artists who have worked with him, achieving success with singles such as "Get It Up", "The Bird", "Cool", "777-9311", "Jungle Love" and "Jerk Out". Morris Day and The Time Website Other Activities and Events JOIN A GROUP FOR A GREAT CAUSE Register for the RunForUs 5K Location Curtis Hixon Waterfront Park 600 N Ashley Drive, Tampa, FL33602 Time April 26, 2025.  All ages are welcomed! Register Today Relive moments from this year's 2025 Music Fest celebration! 2025 Music Fest Sponsors Thank you our sponsors! Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival, Inc. 2020 Business Pitch Competition – tampablackheritage.org Skip to content Menu About TBBHF Organization Info About Mission Statement Board of Directors Applications and Registration Support Support the Festival Sponsorship Volunteer Vendor Opportunities Media TBBHF Over the Years Media Gallery Press Events Join the fun Events Music Fest 2025 Run For Us Festival Events Partner Events Seminars Business Seminars College & Career Conversations Maps & Parking Music Fest Map Downtown Parking Seminars Learn More Business Seminars College & Career Conversations Volunteer Get Involved Contact Us Today or send a Suggestion Quick Links About Us Sponsorship Music Fest 2025 Run For Us 5K FAQs Facebook Twitter Instagram YouTube Open Search Window Home 2020 Business Pitch Competition 2020 Business Pitch Competition The Financial Seminar is a series of FREE professional business seminars hosted by the Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival and the Entrepreneur Collaborative Center . The series takes place throughout the summer and fall months with the larger seminar taking place during the annual Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival in January. The Tampa Bay Black Heritage Entrepreneur Advisory Board, are comprised of local professional business owners who encompass a vast amount of knowledge and skills to help you better your business. BUSINESS PITCH COMPETITION Level Up Business Competition Friday, January 10, 2020 5508 Coworking and Collaboration Exchange at 5508 N. 50th Street, Tampa, Florida 33610. Winner will receive a prize of $1,000 plus FREE Office Space for 1 year at 5508 Co-working & Collaboration Exchange! OBJECTIVE The objective of the competition is to support the development of ventures from ideation to commercialization. This contest reflects the commitment of the Tampa Hillsborough Action Plan, Inc. and the Tampa Black Heritage Festival to support innovation and entrepreneurship for economic prosperity in Hillsborough County specifically East Tampa. Applications Open: November 1, 2019 Application Deadline (Extended) : December 20, 2019 at 5pm Finalists Announced: December 18, 2019 Live Pitch Finale: January 10, 2020 The final live pitch will be held at THAP 5508 campus in Tampa (5508 N. 50th Street Tampa, FL 33610). Finalists must be available to present their idea in person . Download Rules and Guidelines below. Level Up Business Pitch Competition Rules and Guidelines (PDF, 521.1 KB) Apply Online Today! Comments are closed. Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival, Inc. About TBBHF – tampablackheritage.org Skip to content Menu About TBBHF Organization Info About Mission Statement Board of Directors Applications and Registration Support Support the Festival Sponsorship Volunteer Vendor Opportunities Media TBBHF Over the Years Media Gallery Press Events Join the fun Events Music Fest 2025 Run For Us Festival Events Partner Events Seminars Business Seminars College & Career Conversations Maps & Parking Music Fest Map Downtown Parking Seminars Learn More Business Seminars College & Career Conversations Volunteer Get Involved Contact Us Today or send a Suggestion Quick Links About Us Sponsorship Music Fest 2025 Run For Us 5K FAQs Facebook Twitter Instagram YouTube Open Search Window Home About TBBHF About TBBHF The Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival (TBBHF/The Festival) is an annual cultural event that features speakers, musicians, artists, poets and craftspeople locally and nationally. The festival traditionally begins the week-end before the Dr. Martin Luther King, Jr. holiday and extends through the month of April. It’s programming promotes education and cultural sensitivity. Each signature event provides both children and adults with an opportunity to increase their awareness of African and African-American culture and history. This event strives to increase the arts and cultural experiences of its diaspora. Mission The purpose of the Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival, Inc. is to offer the community of Tampa Bay a unique blend of African and African American art, culture and history, therefore serving as a conduit for promoting and perpetuating the art, culture and history of African Americans and African people for the benefit of all Tampa Bay residents and tourists to the Tampa Bay area. It exists to support the culturally rich Tampa Bay communities by ensuring all events are inclusive of the entire community. Board Members The TBBHF board consists of individuals from the Tampa Bay community who participate in organizing the festival and other events throughout the year serving the Tampa Bay community. To view our Board of Directors, click here . Annual Festival The Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival (TBBHF) is Southwest Florida’s premier cultural event organized by the Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival, a 501 c3, Florida non-profit corporation. This annual, family friendly, cultural experience focuses on education, health and wellness, music, economic and social empowerment and the arts. The 2-Day Music Fest, which takes place in April and features local and nationally, recognized musicians, artists, poets, and craftspeople. Comments are closed. Home About TBBHF Announcements DONATE The Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival is the largest African-American event in the bay area and has been selected as one of the Top 20 Events by the Southeast Tourism Society six times, during it’s tenure. Please click the “ Donate Now ” and help us continue our cause. Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival, Inc. Volunteer – tampablackheritage.org Skip to content Menu About TBBHF Organization Info About Mission Statement Board of Directors Applications and Registration Support Support the Festival Sponsorship Volunteer Vendor Opportunities Media TBBHF Over the Years Media Gallery Press Events Join the fun Events Music Fest 2025 Run For Us Festival Events Partner Events Seminars Business Seminars College & Career Conversations Maps & Parking Music Fest Map Downtown Parking Seminars Learn More Business Seminars College & Career Conversations Volunteer Get Involved Contact Us Today or send a Suggestion Quick Links About Us Sponsorship Music Fest 2025 Run For Us 5K FAQs Facebook Twitter Instagram YouTube Open Search Window Home Volunteer Volunteer Become a TBBHF Volunteer! Thanks to our community, the Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival is celebrating another year of the Festival! We need your continued support to grow and provide enhanced cultural enrichment activities to the community. Be a part of something BIG – Volunteer! Select the committee that is of interest to you. Committee meetings will begin in September. Once you make your selection, you will be contacted by that committee’s administrator. All Committees meet prior to the Festival, once and/or twice per month, starting in September. Sponsorship Committee Recommend and assist with sponsorship applications and grant writing.   Generate and distribute sponsorship packets.  Meet, greet and ensure sponsors are comfortable while attending signature events.   Connect with sponsors after January events for critiques and send "Thank you" communications. Events Committee Assist with Signature events planning and sub-committees; attend selected events for set up and break down. Coordinate with marketing and logistics for event needs. Marketing Committee Assist with posting on all social media platforms, creating content; analytics reporting, virtual and physical community engagement; calendar listings; collaborating with videographer and photographer and onsite media.   Pre and onsite interviews (TV, radio, digital, print, surveys, etc.) Logistics Committee Responsible for all things logistical for Signature/Partner events, to include pre and onsite set ups; break downs; signage, deliverables, etc. January Only Register and volunteer for selected Signature/Partner events in January.  Group registration welcome with one submission. Volunteer Committee Assigned to coordinate with Marketing, Logistics and other festival needs, as assigned by Volunteer Committee coordinator(s). Register Today! Volunteer Orientation In order to participate, you must register first. TBBHF 2026 Volunteer Orientation Dates New dates coming soon! All Volunteer Orientations will be virtual and the meeting link will be sent only to registered volunteers. Volunteers under the age of 18 must have a parent or legal guardian register on your behalf and agree to the “Volunteer Terms and Conditions”. We do not recommend anyone under the age of 15 to volunteer. TBBHF Volunteer Registration Comments are closed. Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival, Inc. College & Career Conversations – tampablackheritage.org Skip to content Menu About TBBHF Organization Info About Mission Statement Board of Directors Applications and Registration Support Support the Festival Sponsorship Volunteer Vendor Opportunities Media TBBHF Over the Years Media Gallery Press Events Join the fun Events Music Fest 2025 Run For Us Festival Events Partner Events Seminars Business Seminars College & Career Conversations Maps & Parking Music Fest Map Downtown Parking Seminars Learn More Business Seminars College & Career Conversations Volunteer Get Involved Contact Us Today or send a Suggestion Quick Links About Us Sponsorship Music Fest 2025 Run For Us 5K FAQs Facebook Twitter Instagram YouTube Open Search Window Home College & Career Conversations College & Career Conversations The College and Career Conversations Series is a FREE event hosted by the Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival to help prepare parents and students for the next steps of secondary education and higher learning . Check out our upcoming event listed below! College + Career Conversations Saturday, February 22, 2025  |  11am – 1pm  |  Doors open at 10:45am C. Blythe Andrews Jr. Public Library 2607 E Dr Martin Luther King Jr Blvd Tampa, FL 33610 College & Career Conversations brings together a group of panelists who will share and discuss the strategies, tips, and tools that are needed as students and families consider and prepare for their future path. Learn the insider secrets that will help you better navigate and prepare for your college and career choices. Come ready for another year of insight activities and discussion! Intended Audience: Middle school & high school students and their parents, caregivers, and mentors. Registration for this event is required and will be available on January 20, 2025 . For more information, please contact (813) 573-4454. Register Here Comments are closed. Tampa Bay Black Heritage Festival, Inc. Contact Us Information - Get in Touch Today | Heritage Shops NL Blog Contact Us Home shop Blog Local Makers Contact us Login / Register Search Wishlist 0 items / $ 0.00 Menu 0 items $ 0.00 HTML iFrame Generator FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS Contact Us Information Will I receive the same product that I see in the picture? Yes, we strive to ensure that the product images on our website accurately represent the actual products you will receive. However, please note that there may be slight variations in color or appearance due to factors such as lighting conditions or monitor settings. Rest assured, we make every effort to provide an accurate representation of our products. Where can I view my sales receipt? Once you have completed your purchase, you will receive an email containing your sales receipt. This email will be sent to the email address you provided during the checkout process. Additionally, you can also view your sales receipt within your account on our website. Simply log in to your account and navigate to the "Order History" or "My Purchases" section, where you will be able to find and download your sales receipt. How can I return an item? We understand that sometimes you may need to return an item. To initiate a return, please follow the steps below: Contact our customer service team: Reach out to our customer service team either by phone or email to inform them about your intention to return the item. Provide them with your order details, including the order number and the specific item you wish to return. Review our return policy: Our return policy outlines the conditions and time frame within which returns are accepted. Make sure you familiarize yourself with this policy to ensure your return is eligible. Package the item securely: Place the item back in its original packaging, ensuring it is securely packed to avoid any damage during transit. Include all the original accessories, tags, and documentation that came with the item. Ship the item back to us: Use a reputable shipping service to return the item to our designated address. We recommend using a trackable shipping method to ensure the item reaches us safely. You will be responsible for the return shipping costs unless otherwise specified in our return policy. Await confirmation and refund: Once we receive the returned item and verify its condition, we will process your refund according to our refund policy. This may include refunding the purchase price, minus any applicable restocking fees or shipping charges. Please note that certain items may be non-returnable or subject to specific return conditions, such as personalized or customized products. It's important to review our return policy and contact our customer service team for further assistance and guidance throughout the return process. Will you restock items indicated as “out of stock?” We understand that it can be disappointing to find an item marked as out of stock. We strive to restock our inventory regularly to ensure a wide selection of products for our customers. However, the availability of restocking depends on various factors, including supplier availability, production schedules, and demand for the product. To stay updated on the availability of out-of-stock items, we recommend the following: Sign up for notifications: On the product page, you may find an option to sign up for notifications when the item is back in stock. By providing your email address, you will receive an alert as soon as the item becomes available again. Check our website regularly: We regularly update our website with new stock and restocked items. Keep an eye on the product page or browse through our inventory to see if the item you are interested in has been restocked. Contact our customer service: If you have a specific inquiry about a particular item or need assistance with availability, feel free to reach out to our customer service team. They will be happy to provide you with the most up-to-date information and assist you in any way they can. While we strive to restock popular items, please note that there may be instances where certain products are discontinued or not available for restocking due to various reasons. However, we are always looking to enhance our product offerings, so we encourage you to explore alternative options or similar items that may meet your needs. We appreciate your understanding and patience as we work to ensure a diverse and well-stocked inventory for our valued customers. Where can I ship my order? We offer several options for shipping your order to ensure convenience and flexibility. Here are the available shipping methods: In-store pickup: If you prefer to collect your items in person, you can choose to pick up your order at only at our store at 158 Duckworth St., St. John's, NL. Simply select the "In-store Pickup" option during the checkout process, and we will notify you when your order is ready for pickup. This is a great option if you are located near one of our store locations and want to save on shipping costs. Local delivery: For customers in the local area (St. John's, Mount Pearl), we provide a convenient delivery service for a nominal fee of $5. Our team will deliver your order directly to your specified address. This option allows for faster delivery and ensures your items reach you safely. Shipping via third-party carrier: If you are located outside of our local area or prefer to use a shipping carrier of your choice, you can select this option during checkout. We partner with reliable shipping companies to ensure your order is delivered securely and efficiently. Simply provide your preferred shipping address, and we will arrange for the carrier to pick up and deliver your items. During the checkout process, you will have the opportunity to select your preferred shipping method based on your location and preference. The applicable shipping fees, if any, will be clearly indicated before you finalize your order. Please note that shipping options may vary depending on your location and the availability of certain carriers. We strive to provide a range of shipping choices to accommodate our customers' needs. If you have any specific shipping inquiries or require assistance in selecting the most suitable shipping option for your order, our customer service team will be happy to assist you. What is Store policies for all of that items? Refunds : If you would like to return one of your purchases, you can do so within 14 days of receiving your shipment. You should contact us prior to shipping your item back. Please note that the customer will be responsible for returning the item to the Historic Sites Association at their own expense. A refund will only be issued once the item is received and inspected. The item must be unused, in its original packaging, and in resalable condition for a full refund. The following item categories are final sale only and not eligible for refund: sale items, earrings, and food. If you received a damaged or incorrect item, please see the “damages” section below. Shipping : Orders will ship from the Historic Sites Association Warehouse within 1-3 business days . We ensure your items are packaged securely to arrive to you in pristine condition, however, we do use re-purposed packaging materials whenever possible to reduce waste. We try our best to apply accurate shipping calculations at checkout, but in the event of a significant overcharge, you will be refunded the difference. Payment: Our online store accepts payment through Paypal , Apple Pay , and major credit cards on the Stripe platform. Your credit card information is processed securely online. See the following from Stripe’s Policies : “When you use Stripe Checkout on a merchant’s website to store your payment credentials, we will gather and store your payment card information, your email address, your mobile phone number, and billing and shipping address. We will use this information to complete purchases that you choose to make on other websites or applications that also use Stripe Checkout, but only with your permission . We may also share your contact information, but not your card information, with merchants as part of your purchases. We will not share this information with other third parties except as a necessary part of providing our Website and Services . You should carefully review merchants’ privacy policies to better understand how each uses your information.” Orders can also be processed over the phone by credit card. You can call or e-mail your selected items to us and we will confirm the order and shipping cost, and then contact you for payment. For a phone order, your credit card details are entered directly into the payment processing machine at the time of purchase and a hard copy is never produced , keeping your details secure and confidential. Damages : In the unlikely event that you receive an item that is damaged, or is not what you ordered, please contact us as soon as possible after receiving your order. Photos of affected items, and of defective shipping materials (if applicable), are a huge asset and should be forwarded to the e-mail address below.
